Requirements: Be a high school graduate or have a high school equivalency diploma (GED); Pass the entrance exam; Submit a completed application form; Provide proof of U.S. citizenship, permanent residency, or other legal status; Attend a personal interview with the Program Director; Be in good health and be able to perform all the essential functions of a sonographer; Prior to enrollment, prospective students must have completed a two-year allied health education program that is patient-care related. Examples include, but are not limited to, diagnostic medical sonographer, radiologic technologist, registered nurse, respiratory therapist, or medical assistant. All prerequisite coursework must be completed with a grade of C or better.
Description: The Diagnostic Cardiac Sonography (DCS) program at AIMS Education is a certificate program designed to prepare students for a career as an echocardiography technologist. Students will gain the knowledge and skills needed to perform echocardiograms, which are ultrasound tests that produce live images of the heart. These images help cardiologists evaluate a patient’s heart and diagnose various heart conditions. The program curriculum covers a range of subjects, including anatomy and physiology, cardiovascular pathophysiology, ultrasound physics, and patient care. Students will learn how to operate ultrasound equipment, perform various echocardiography procedures, and analyze the resulting images. The curriculum is a combination of classroom instruction and hands-on training in our state-of-the-art ultrasound labs. In addition to the didactic and lab training, students will also complete a clinical externship at an affiliated healthcare facility. The externship provides students with the opportunity to apply their knowledge and skills in a real-world setting. Students will work alongside experienced echocardiography technologists and other healthcare professionals to provide patient care. Upon successful completion of the DCS program, graduates will be eligible to sit for the national certification exams administered by the American Registry for Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS) and Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI). Graduates will receive a certificate of completion from AIMS Education.
Accredidation: The AIMS Diagnostic Cardiac Sonography program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (www.caahep.org) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (JRC-DMS).

Description: The Cardiovascular Invasive Specialist (CVIS) certificate program at AIMS Education is designed for allied health professionals who are looking to advance their careers in the field of cardiovascular technology. This advanced program provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to work as integral members of the cardiac catheterization and interventional cardiology teams. The primary goal of the CVIS program is to prepare competent entry-level cardiovascular invasive specialists in the cognitive (knowledge), psychomotor (skills), and affective (behavior) learning domains. Students will learn how to assist cardiologists with cardiac catheterization procedures. They will learn to perform various diagnostic and interventional procedures, including coronary angioplasty, stenting, and other complex cardiac interventions. The program curriculum is a blend of classroom instruction, hands-on lab training, and extensive clinical experience. Students receive comprehensive training in cardiovascular anatomy and physiology, sterile technique, patient care, EKG interpretation, hemodynamic monitoring, and radiation safety. Upon successful completion of the program, graduates are eligible to sit for the Registered Cardiovascular Invasive Specialist (RCIS) credentialing exam administered by Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI).
Accredidation: The Cardiovascular Invasive Specialist program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (www.caahep.org) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Cardiovascular Technology (JRC-CVT).

Requirements: To be considered for admission, prospective students must meet the following general requirements: Be at least 18 years of age; Possess a high school diploma or its equivalent (GED); Submit an application for admission; Complete an admissions interview; Provide a valid, government-issued photo ID; Pass the entrance exam. In addition to the general admissions requirements, applicants to the Anesthesia Technologist program must also: Complete the AIMS Pre-Entrance Health Assessment Packet; Submit to a background check and drug screen; Meet all applicable program-specific requirements.
Description: The Anesthesia Technician program at AIMS Education is designed to prepare students for a successful career in the healthcare field. Through a combination of classroom instruction and hands-on training, students will gain the knowledge and skills needed to assist anesthesiologists and other medical professionals in the administration of anesthesia. The program curriculum covers a range of topics, including medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, pharmacology, anesthesia equipment, and patient monitoring. Students will learn how to prepare and maintain anesthesia equipment, assist with the administration of anesthesia, and monitor patients' vital signs during surgery. The program also includes a clinical externship, which provides students with the opportunity to apply their skills in a real-world healthcare setting. Upon completion of the program, graduates will be eligible to take the American Society of Anesthesia Technologists and Technicians (ASATT) National Certification Examination. Passing this exam leads to certification as a Certified Anesthesia Technician (Cer.A.T.).

Requirements:
The admissions requirements are as follows:

*   Submit a completed application for admission.
*   Must have a high school diploma or its equivalent (i.e. GED – General Education Diploma).
*   Schedule a personal interview with an admissions representative.
*   Take and pass the entrance exam. *Students who have an associate’s degree or higher from an accredited institution are not required to take the entrance exam.*
*   Submit an official high school transcript or an official copy of the GED test scores. If an applicant has an associate’s degree or higher from an accredited institution, an official college transcript can be submitted in lieu of the high school transcript. All official transcripts must be sent directly to AIMS Education from the issuing institution.
*   Submit a completed Health (Physical) Examination Form.
*   Submit proof of immunization for measles, mumps, rubella, and varicella.
*   Submit a completed criminal background check with no disqualifying information.
*   Submit results of a 10-panel drug screening.
Description: The Pharmacy Technician certificate program at AIMS Education is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become a pharmacy technician. The program is taught by experienced faculty who are dedicated to helping students succeed. The curriculum is comprehensive and covers a wide range of topics, including pharmacology, pharmacy law and ethics, and sterile and non-sterile compounding. Students in the pharmacy technician program at AIMS will learn how to: Process and fill prescriptions; Manage inventory and order supplies; Prepare sterile and non-sterile compounds; Provide customer service; Comply with all state and federal regulations. In addition to classroom instruction, students in the pharmacy technician program at AIMS will also complete a clinical externship. The externship will give students the opportunity to apply their knowledge and skills in a real-world setting. Students will work with licensed pharmacists and other healthcare professionals to provide care to patients. The externship is an invaluable part of the program and will help students prepare for a successful career as a pharmacy technician.
Accredidation: The Pharmacy Technician program at AIMS Education is accredited by the American Society of Health-System Pharmacists (ASHP)/Accreditation Council for Pharmacy Education (ACPE).
ScholarshipType: High School Scholarship, Alumni Scholarship, Military Scholarship

Description: The Medical Billing and Coding (MBC) program at AIMS Education is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary for a career in the healthcare industry. Medical billers and coders are responsible for processing and managing patient data, such as treatment records and insurance information. They code patients’ medical information for reimbursement purposes. The MBC program provides students with a strong foundation in medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, and pharmacology. The curriculum is comprehensive and covers all the major topics in medical billing and coding. Students will learn about the different types of medical codes, as well as how to use them correctly. In addition, they will learn about the different types of insurance plans and how to process claims. Throughout the program students will get hands-on experience using the latest electronic health record (EHR) software. Upon completion of the program, students will be well-prepared to take the national certification exam and begin their careers as medical billers and coders.
ScholarshipType: Federal Pell Grants, Federal Direct Loans, Federal Work-Study, Veterans Benefits

Requirements: All applicants must have a high school diploma or its equivalent (e.g., GED). Applicants must be at least 18 years of age or older (17 years of age with parental consent). Prospective students are required to complete an informational interview with an admissions representative and take and pass the Wonderlic Scholastic Level Exam. Prior to starting class, students must complete the enrollment agreement.
Description:
The Sterile Processing Technician certificate program at AIMS Education provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become an integral part of a surgical team. Sterile processing technicians are responsible for decontaminating, cleaning, processing, assembling, sterilizing, storing and distributing the medical devices and supplies needed in patient care, especially during surgery.
The program is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the sterile processing field. The curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including:

*   Medical Terminology
*   Anatomy and Physiology
*   Microbiology and Infection Control
*   Decontamination and Sterilization Procedures
*   Surgical Instrumentation

In addition to classroom instruction, students will also receive hands-on training in a simulated sterile processing department. This will give them the opportunity to apply the skills they have learned in a realistic setting. Upon completion of the program, graduates will be prepared to sit for the Certified Registered Central Service Technician (CRCST) certification exam.

Requirements:
To be considered for admission, prospective students must:
Be at least 18 years of age (or 17 with parental consent)
Provide a valid form of identification
Have a high school diploma or its equivalent (e.g. GED, TASC)
Complete an interview with an admissions representative
Successfully pass the entrance exam
Submit a completed application and enrollment agreement
Attend a new student orientation
Description: The Medical Assistant certificate program provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become a successful medical assistant. It is one of the most popular and fastest growing allied health careers. As a medical assistant, you will be a versatile and valuable member of a healthcare team. The training at AIMS prepares students to handle both the administrative and clinical duties of a medical assistant. Administrative duties may include answering phones, greeting patients, managing appointments, handling correspondence, and updating patient records. Clinical duties may include taking medical histories, recording vital signs, preparing patients for examinations, and assisting the physician during exams. Our program includes a comprehensive curriculum with courses in anatomy and physiology, medical terminology, pharmacology, EKG, phlebotomy, and medical law and ethics. Students will learn the necessary skills to perform a variety of clinical procedures, such as administering medications, drawing blood, and performing basic laboratory tests. Upon successful completion of the program, graduates are eligible to take a national certification exam to become a Certified Medical Assistant (CMA), a Registered Medical Assistant (RMA), or a National Certified Medical Assistant (NCMA).
Accredidation: Our MA program is programmatically accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP).

Requirements: Must be a high school graduate or have a recognized equivalent (GED). Must be 18 years of age or older. (Applicants who are 17 may be admitted with parental consent.) Must complete an admissions interview. Must submit a completed enrollment application. Must achieve a minimum score on the entrance examination. Must be a U.S. citizen or a permanent resident.
Description:
The Patient Care Technician certificate program at AIMS Education is a comprehensive allied health program designed to prepare students for a career as a Patient Care Technician (PCT) or Patient Care Associate (PCA). Students will be trained to provide patient care in a variety of healthcare settings, including hospitals, clinics, nursing homes, and long-term care facilities.

Students will learn to provide basic patient care under the supervision of nursing staff. The primary responsibilities of a PCT include providing direct patient care, such as bathing, feeding, and dressing. They are also responsible for taking vital signs, collecting specimens, performing catheterization, providing wound care, performing EKGs, and carrying out pre-operative preparations. Students will learn how to safely transfer patients and assist them with the use of walkers, wheelchairs, and other medical equipment. Upon successful completion of the program, graduates will be well-prepared for entry-level positions as patient care technicians.

The EKG/Phlebotomy Technician certificate program provides students with the training they need to become vital members of a healthcare team. The program is designed to provide students with the fundamental knowledge and skills required for a career as an EKG Technician and Phlebotomy Technician. The curriculum provides students with a foundation in healthcare, anatomy and physiology, and medical terminology. Students will receive hands-on training in our on-campus labs, which are designed to simulate a real-world healthcare environment. The EKG portion of the program focuses on the anatomy and physiology of the heart, principles of EKG, and recognition of dysrhythmias. The phlebotomy portion of the program provides instruction on blood-borne pathogens, infection control, and venipuncture techniques. Upon successful completion of the program, graduates will be eligible to sit for national certification exams.

The Cardiac Monitor Technician certificate program at AIMS Education is designed to prepare students for a career as a cardiac monitor technician. The program provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to monitor and interpret cardiac rhythms in a healthcare setting. Cardiac monitor technicians, also known as telemetry technicians, are an important part of the healthcare team. They are responsible for observing patient heart rhythms and reporting any abnormalities to the nursing and medical staff. The curriculum for the Cardiac Monitor Technician program includes a combination of classroom instruction and hands-on training. Students learn about cardiac anatomy and physiology, electrocardiography (ECG), and arrhythmia interpretation. They also receive training in the use of telemetry monitoring equipment and basic life support (BLS). Upon completion of the program, graduates are eligible to take the Certified Rhythm Analysis Technician (CRAT) examination offered by Cardiovascular Credentialing International (CCI). The program is a great choice for individuals who are detail-oriented, have strong analytical skills, and are interested in working in the healthcare field. It can serve as an entry point into the healthcare industry or as a stepping stone for further education and career advancement in cardiology or other related fields.

The Phlebotomy Technician certificate program at AIMS Education provides students with the knowledge and skills necessary to work in a variety of medical settings, including hospitals, clinical laboratories, and physicians’ offices. The program curriculum includes anatomy and physiology, medical terminology, and phlebotomy techniques. Students will also receive hands-on training in our on-campus labs. Our experienced instructors will guide them through every step of the process, from learning how to properly identify patients to drawing blood and handling specimens. Upon completion of the program, students will be prepared to take the national certification exam and begin their careers as phlebotomy technicians. Our career services team is also available to provide job placement assistance to our graduates.

Requirements: An associate degree is required to enroll in the DMS program. A healthcare-related degree is preferred, but not required. A formal interview with the Program Director is required for admission into the program. Applicants must also have completed the following prerequisite coursework: Anatomy and Physiology I with Lab (4 credits), Anatomy and Physiology II with Lab (4 credits), College-level Math (3 credits), College-level Physics (3 credits), Medical Terminology (3 credits), English Composition (3 credits), Interpersonal Communications (3 credits). General admissions requirements include being at least 18 years old upon program completion, having a high school diploma or GED, completing an admissions interview, and potentially taking an entrance exam.
Department: AIMS Education College of Health Sciences
Description: AIMS Education offers an Associate of Science (A.S.) degree in Diagnostic Medical Sonography. The program is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to become competent entry-level sonographers. Our Diagnostic Medical Sonography program integrates classroom instruction, laboratory scanning, and supervised clinical experience to ensure comprehensive training. AIMS provides a dynamic learning environment where students master the art and science of sonography. From understanding ultrasound physics to performing various diagnostic procedures, our curriculum covers a broad spectrum of topics essential for a successful career in sonography. Diagnostic medical sonographers use special equipment to generate and record images of the human body. Sonographers create images of various parts of the body, including the abdomen, breast, heart, blood vessels, and pelvis. These images, called sonograms, are then interpreted by physicians to diagnose and monitor various medical conditions. The Diagnostic Medical Sonography program at AIMS is designed to help students develop the knowledge and practical skills needed to be successful in this exciting career. Students learn to operate ultrasound equipment and perform sonographic examinations. They also learn about patient care, medical ethics, and how to communicate effectively with patients and other healthcare professionals. Our program provides a solid foundation in anatomy, physiology, and pathology, preparing students to excel in various clinical settings.
Accredidation: The Diagnostic Medical Sonography program at AIMS Education is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP) upon the recommendation of the Joint Review Committee on Education in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (JRC-DMS).
ScholarshipType: AIMS Scholarship, High School Scholarship, Alumni Scholarship

Requirements: Must possess a high school diploma or GED. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must pass the entrance exam. Must be a U.S. citizen or a legal resident. Must be in good health. Must submit to a background check and drug screening.
Description: The MRI Technologist program at AIMS Education provides students with the academic knowledge and clinical skills to prepare them for a rewarding career as an MRI Technologist. Our students learn to operate advanced MRI equipment and perform MRI exams, which are used to help physicians diagnose medical conditions. Our comprehensive curriculum includes both didactic instruction and hands-on clinical training, providing students with the knowledge and practical experience necessary to excel in the field. Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Technologists are highly skilled healthcare professionals who operate MRI scanners to create detailed images of the human body. These images are used by physicians to diagnose and monitor a wide range of medical conditions, from neurological disorders to musculoskeletal injuries. MRI Technologists play a critical role in patient care, ensuring patient comfort and safety during scans, and producing high-quality images that aid in accurate diagnosis. Program Goals: To provide students with a comprehensive understanding of MRI physics, imaging techniques, and patient care. To develop students’ clinical skills in operating MRI equipment, positioning patients, and performing MRI examinations safely and effectively. To prepare students for successful entry-level employment as MRI Technologists. To foster professionalism, ethical conduct, and a commitment to lifelong learning in the field of Magnetic Resonance Imaging.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Accrediting Bureau of Health Education Schools (ABHES).

Description: Medical assistants are multi-skilled allied health professionals who perform administrative and clinical duties in the offices of physicians, podiatrists, chiropractors, and other health practitioners. They are often the first person a patient sees in a healthcare setting and their positive attitude and competency can set the tone for the entire patient visit. The Medical Assistant program at AIMS Education prepares graduates to enter the healthcare field as competent, versatile, and in-demand medical assistants. During the program, students will learn how to perform administrative duties such as scheduling appointments, maintaining medical records, billing and coding information for insurance purposes, and assisting patients with financial and other forms. They will also learn how to assist with clinical duties such as taking vital signs, preparing patients for examinations, drawing blood, administering medications, and performing diagnostic tests. The AIMS Medical Assistant program includes a supervised clinical externship, which provides students with real-world experience prior to graduation. Graduates of the program are eligible to sit for national certification exams offered by the National Healthcareer Association (NHA) to earn their Certified Clinical Medical Assistant (CCMA) credential.
Accredidation: AIMS Education is accredited by the Accrediting Bureau of Health Education Schools (ABHES) and licensed by the New Jersey Commission on Higher Education.

Requirements: Applicants must be at least 18 years of age. Applicants must have a high school diploma or its equivalent (GED). Applicants must attend an information session. Applicants must pass an admissions entrance exam. Applicants must meet the general admission requirements of AIMS Education.
Description: Surgical Technologists, also called Operating Room Technicians, are integral members of the surgical team and play a critical role in providing a safe and effective surgical experience for patients. The AIMS Education Surgical Technologist Program teaches students how to prepare operating rooms, arrange and maintain instruments, supplies, and equipment, and assist surgeons, nurses, and anesthesiologists during surgical procedures. Surgical technologists work under the supervision of a surgeon or registered nurse. Surgical technologists handle instruments, supplies, and equipment necessary during the surgical procedure. They also have an understanding of the procedure to anticipate the needs of the surgeon. Surgical Technologists perform a variety of duties before, during, and after surgical procedures. They prepare operating rooms for surgery, ensure the cleanliness of the instruments, maintain a sterile environment, and assist the surgeon and surgical team during procedures. They may also be responsible for maintaining patient records and transporting patients to and from the operating room.
Accredidation: The Surgical Technologist program is accredited by the Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education Programs (CAAHEP).

Description: At AIMS Education, our Bachelor of Arts in Special Education program is designed to empower aspiring educators with the knowledge, skills, and compassion needed to make a meaningful difference in the lives of students with diverse learning needs. This comprehensive program prepares you to work with individuals across various age groups, from early childhood through adolescence, equipping you with the pedagogical expertise and practical experience essential for a successful career in special education. In our Special Education Teacher program, you will delve into a wide range of topics and gain practical experience through fieldwork and student teaching placements. Key areas of study include: Child development and learning theories, Assessment and diagnostic strategies for diverse learners, Individualized education program (IEP) development and implementation, Instructional strategies for various disabilities (e.g., learning disabilities, autism spectrum disorder, emotional disturbances), Behavior management techniques and positive behavior interventions, Collaborative practices with families, general education teachers, and other professionals, Legal and ethical considerations in special education.

Requirements: In order to apply for the Pharmacy Technician program, prospective students must meet the following requirements: High school diploma or its equivalent (GED); Be at least 18 years of age (or 17 with parental consent); Pass the entrance exam; Complete an interview with an admissions representative; Submit a completed enrollment application; Complete all enrollment documents.
Description: Pharmacy technicians are vital members of any healthcare team. Under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, they play a crucial role in preparing and dispensing prescription medications. At AIMS, our Pharmacy Technician program provides students with the foundational knowledge and practical skills necessary to excel in this in-demand field. Our curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including pharmacology, pharmaceutical calculations, medication dispensing, inventory management, and pharmacy law and ethics. Through a combination of classroom instruction and hands-on training, students gain a comprehensive understanding of pharmacy operations and patient care. Our program also includes an externship component, allowing students to apply their skills in real-world pharmacy settings and gain valuable experience.

An Endoscopy Technician is an integral part of an endoscopy team that assists physicians in endoscopic procedures. As an Endoscopy Technician, you will be performing duties such as assisting in advanced gastrointestinal (GI) procedures, cleaning and maintaining equipment, and preparing procedure rooms. This program will provide you with the necessary skills to be successful in this exciting healthcare field. The Endoscopy Technician program at AIMS is designed to help students master the knowledge and skills necessary to become a certified Endoscopy Technician. The Endoscopy Technician curriculum covers essential areas such as: Anatomy and Physiology related to the GI tract, Patient preparation and care, Endoscopic equipment and instrumentation, Sterilization and disinfection techniques, Assisting in various endoscopic procedures, Emergency procedures and patient safety.

Requirements: All applicants must have a high school diploma or a recognized equivalent (GED).
Department: AIMS Education College of Health Sciences
Description: The Medical Billing & Coding Specialist program at AIMS Education is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to secure entry-level employment in the medical billing and coding field. Students learn to translate medical documentation into alphanumeric codes, accurately submit claims for reimbursement, and understand the medical revenue cycle. Our program is a hybrid online and on-campus program, meaning some of the classes are available to be taken at home, with a few weekly lab sessions on-campus. Students in our Medical Billing & Coding Specialist program learn to identify the information needed to support diagnoses, procedures, and services, and correctly assign appropriate codes. Courses in the Medical Billing & Coding Specialist program include medical terminology, anatomy and physiology, electronic health records, professional medical coding, and more. Additionally, students receive training in front-office and back-office skills to prepare them for a variety of work environments. Medical billers and coders are key members of the medical revenue cycle team and are responsible for ensuring healthcare providers are accurately reimbursed for services provided to patients. Medical billing and coding specialists play a vital role in medical offices by translating the care a patient receives into billable codes, which are then used to submit claims to insurance companies. Without them, doctors and other medical professionals wouldn't get paid. As such, the demand for qualified medical billing and coding specialists is consistently high, leading to excellent job prospects for graduates.
